answers.answer: Under no circumstances should you be under the "care" of a non-MD, non-physician optometrist (had a O.D. degree after his name). You should be under the care of a MD, physician ophthalmologist. Specifically with this problem I would suggest a Eye MD specializing in retina disease.  Find one at www.aao.orgThis is a very serious problem and the first thing is to find out what caused the bleeding. The most common things would be: diabetic proliferative retinopathy, retinal tear, retinal detachment, blockage of the main veins in the eye.This is VERY important.JCH III MD
